SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Camera
The Camera class represents a virtual camera in a 3D environment.
Constants
The Constants class holds various static constants used in the 3D engine.
DirectionalLight
The DirectionalLight class represents a directional light source in a 3D scene.
EngineManager
The EngineManager class is responsible for managing the game engine, including initialization, the main game loop, and cleanup procedures.
Entity
The Entity class represents an object in a 3D space with a model, position, rotation, and scale.
ILogic
The ILogic interface represents the logic component of a game or application.
Main
The Main class serves as the entry point for the application.
Material
The Material class represents the visual properties of an object in the scene, including ambient, diffuse, and specular colors, reflectance, and an optional texture.
Model
The Model class represents a 3D model with an ID, vertex count, and associated material.
MouseInput
The MouseInput class handles mouse input, including cursor position, button presses, and displacement vector.
ObjectLoader
The ObjectLoader class is responsible for loading 3D models in the Wavefront OBJ format and managing associated resources.
PointLight
The PointLight class represents a point light source in a 3D scene.
RenderManager
The RenderManager class manages rendering operations, including initializing shaders, binding models, preparing entities, rendering lights, and rendering entities.
ShaderManager
The ShaderManager class is responsible for managing shaders in OpenGL, including creating, compiling, and linking shaders, setting uniform variables, and cleaning up resources.
SpotLight
The SpotLight class represents a spotlight in a 3D scene, which is essentially a directional PointLight with a defined cone of influence.
TestGame
The TestGame class implements the game logic for the 3D engine.
Texture
The Texture class represents a texture used in rendering 3D models.
Transformation
The Transformation class provides utility methods for creating transformation matrices.
Utils
The Utils class provides utility methods for handling common tasks.
WindowManager
The WindowManager class manages the creation, configuration, and interaction with the GLFW window in an OpenGL application, including input handling, window resizing, and updating the projection matrix.
